required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Bowel CLEAnsing: A National Initiative
clinical_study.official_title: The Bowel CLEAnsing: A National Initiative

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare diet, type of bowel preparation and time of colonoscopy to determine if one method is better than the other and, if they are the same, identify the one which is the most convenient for the patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of the current proposed trial is thus to compare the cleanliness achieved with PEG high-volume (2L+2L) split-dose versus PEG (1L+1L)+Bisacodyl low-volume split-dose, or PEG high volume (4L) non-split day before versus PEG low volume (2L) non-split same day preparation, according to time of endoscopy (early or later), as well as assess the role of diet (low residue or clear liquid diet) according to these different Canadian outpatient preparation regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Bowel cleansing according to the Boston Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject willingness to repeat the preparation (survey)
Withdrawal time and total procedural time
Cecal or ileal intubation rate for colonoscopies
Specific lesional rates identified according to pathology
% of preparation taken by the subject
Subject travel time to endoscopy unit (hrs)
Ottawa Bowel Preparation Scores compared to BBPS

intervention.description: Colyte® or PegLyte® will be provided to the subject who will be asked to drink 2L of the preparation starting at 7:00 PM the day before the procedure at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes until completed. The second dose of 2L of preparation will be taken the morning of the colonoscopy starting 4-5 hours prior to the planned procedural time at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes until completed.
intervention.arm_group_label: 1) Early colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, split-dose; 3)Clear liquid
1) Early colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, split-dose; 3)Low residue
1) Later colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, split-dose; 3)Clear liquid
1) Later colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, split-dose; 3)Low residue

intervention.description: Bi-PegLyte® will be provided to the subject who will be asked to ingest 3 tabs of Bisacodyl 5 mg (total 15 mg) at 2:00 PM the day before the procedure. After the first bowel movement, or if there is no bowel movement within 6 hours of taking the Bisacodyl tablets, the subject will be asked to drink 1L of the solution at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes until the solution is completed. The second dose of 1L of preparation will be taken the morning of the colonoscopy starting 4-5 hours prior to the procedure at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes. Use of antacids will not be permitted within one hour of taking bisacodyl.
intervention.arm_group_label: 1) Early colonoscopy; 2) Low volume split-dose; 3)Clear liquid
1) Early colonoscopy; 2) Low volume split-dose; 3)Low residue
1) Later colonoscopy; 2) Low volume split-dose; 3)Clear liquid

intervention.intervention_name: High volume PEG non split, day before
intervention.description: Colyte® or PegLyte® will be provided to the subject who will be asked to drink 4L of preparation starting at 6:00 PM the day before the procedure, at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes until completed.
intervention.arm_group_label: 1) Early colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, day before; 3)Clear liquid
1) Early colonoscopy; 2) High-dose, day before; 3)Low residue

intervention.intervention_name: Low volume PEG non split, same day
intervention.description: Bi-PegLyte® will be provided to the subject, who will be asked to ingest 3 tabs of Bisacodyl 5 mg (total 15 mg) at 2:00 PM the day before the procedure and will drink 2L of preparation the morning of the colonoscopy starting 4 hours prior to the procedure at a rate of 240 mL every 10 minutes, until completed. Use of antacids will not be permitted within one hour of taking Bisacodyl.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Outpatients
- 18 years or older
- Able to comprehend the trial
- Have an indication for full colonoscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
Subjects are excluded from enrollment into the study if any of the following are present:
General exclusion criteria:
- Subject refusal
- Previous bowel preparation in the last 14 days
- Pregnancy or breastfeeding
- Reduced mobility
Medical/Endoscopic exclusion criteria:
- Suspected or diagnosed with bowel obstruction
- Any colonic surgery
- Toxic megacolon
- Ileus
- Ischemic colitis
- Decompensated heart failure
- Severe acute renal failure
- Severe liver disease
- Severe electrolyte imbalance

facility.name: Forzani & MacPhail Colon Cancer Screening Centre
Health Sciences center and St. Boniface Hospital
Hôpital St-Sacrement, CHU de Québec-Université Laval
